author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with an uppercase letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, not all letters are uppercase.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

[noblock]This name (FFAST) matches the common abbreviated name for the database (https://www.nist.gov/pml/note-nist-x-ray-attenuation-databases) on which it is based.  This would seem to match the package naming guidelines suggestion that "Packages that wrap external libraries or programs should be named after those libraries or programs."

@giordano Will I be forced to change the name to get this package on the Julia registry?  I'd rather not for the reasons I expressed above.  In the X-ray microanalysis) community, FFAST is a well recognized acronym for this data set.  I'm anxious to get this package on the registry so I can register some additional packages that depend on it.  Thanks.

body:
- Registering package: FFAST
- Repository: https://github.com/usnistgov/FFAST.jl
- Created by: @NicholasWMRitchie
- Version: v1.0.0
- Commit: a08725124c10fdfab9c01ec07b444034e4339623
- Git reference: v1.0.0
- Release notes:
<!-- BEGIN RELEASE NOTES -->
> Initial public release of a lean implementation of the FFAST X-ray mass absorption coefficient database
<!-- END RELEASE NOTES -->
title: New package: FFAST v1.0.0
